2.comment: Dee Ford had a breakout game in relief of the injured Justin Houston. Ford collected 3 sacks and had many more hurries, as he basically lived in San Diego's backfield. Rivers went 24-of-43 for 263 yards and an interception, which wasn't his fault; the ball bounced off the hobbled Floyd. Rivers could've been picked several more times when he made some desperation heaves downfield on the final drive. opponent_score.sentence: Amari Cooper was excellent with 10 catches for 129 yards.

defense_sacks.sentence: Derek Carr was 22-of-34 for 225 yards with a touchdown and an interception.

defense_tackles.sentence: Dee Ford strip-sacked Carr and Tamba Hali recovered to take points away from Oakland midway through the 4.

3.comment: Dee Ford strip-sacked Carr and Tamba Hali recovered to take points away from Oakland midway through the 4.h quarter. That turnover pretty much ended any hopes for a Raiders comeback, and Ford added a 4.h down sack in garbage time.    Derek Carr was 22-of-34 for 225 yards with a touchdown and an interception. Carr was fortunate a few passes weren't picked off. Amari Cooper was excellent with 10 catches for 129 yards.    Once again, the Raiders didn't have much of a running game as they were led by DeAndre Washington (10-49) with Latavius Murray out.    Alex Smith was 19-of-22 for 224 yards with zero touchdowns and zero interceptions. Jeremy Maclin led the Chiefs in receiving with 3 receptions for 49 yards. Travis Kelce was held to 3 catches for 32 yards and wasn't targeted much.    Spencer Ware was superb, running for 131 yards and a score on 24 carries with 2 catches for 32 yards. Jamaal Charles had 9 carries for 33 yards with a score and 2 receptions for 14 yards.    Defensively, Karl Joseph played well for the Raiders with 9 tackles. Oakland's Khalil Mack beat Eric Fisher for a sack and added 7 tackles. For the Chiefs, Derrick Johnson was very good with 9 tackles and Dee Ford added 2 sacks.   Ford strip-sacked Carr and Tamba Hali recovered to take points away from Oakland midway through the 4.h quarter. That turnover pretty much ended any hopes for a Raiders comeback, and Ford added a 4.h down sack in garbage time.

4.comment: Dee Ford went absolutely nuts. Ford racked up 3.5 sacks, exposing a huge weakness on Indianapolis' offensive line. The right tackle spot is a nightmare, and I'm sure general manager Ryan Grigson will blame Ford went absolutely nuts. 5.comment: Dee Ford continued his breakout season with 2 sacks. Cornerback Stephen Nelson had a good game for Kansas City despite a dropped interception.   Ford continued his breakout season with 2 sacks. Cornerback Stephen Nelson had a good game for Kansas City despite a dropped interception.

6.comment: Dee Ford came off the edge completely unblocked. Booker, however, was guilty of a lost fumble in the 4.h quarter that effectively ended the Broncos' slim chances of covering the spread.
